relationships.subject: maris:neoli_criteria
relationships.quantification: MPAs meeting all 5 criteria have 670% higher biomass

relationships.subject: no_take_protection
relationships.mechanism: Elimination of fishing mortality allows population rebuilding
relationships.quantification: 463% recovery in 10 years at Cabo Pulmo

relationships.subject: maris:coral_reef
relationships.mechanism: Wave energy dissipation at reef crest (97%)

relationships.subject: maris:cabo_pulmo_np
relationships.notes: Critical habitat for endemic leopard grouper

relationships.subject: enforcement_level
relationships.quantification: 2.3x difference between well and poorly enforced

relationships.subject: maris:seagrass_meadow
relationships.quantification: 35x faster carbon capture than tropical rainforest

relationships.subject: maris:mangrove_forest
relationships.quantification: 10x carbon removal rate vs tropical forest

relationships.subject: marine_heatwave
relationships.mechanism: Thermal stress mortality and regime shifts

relationships.subject: maris:seagrass_meadow
relationships.quantification: Median 24.2 Mg Corg/ha in top 30cm; global seagrass NPP 5,833 kg C/ha/yr
relationships.mechanism: Photosynthetic carbon fixation and burial in anoxic sediment soils over centennial to millennial timescales

relationships.subject: maris:seagrass_carbon_sequestration
relationships.quantification: Net offset 0.42 tCO2e/ha/yr for restoration; conservation projects up to $1.53M/10yr for 100ha
relationships.mechanism: Verified carbon sequestration and avoided emissions from seagrass conservation/restoration quantified under VCS methodology

relationships.subject: maris:voluntary_carbon_credit
relationships.mechanism: VM0033 v2.1 provides standardized methodology for quantifying GHG reductions from tidal wetland and seagrass restoration

relationships.subject: marine_heatwave
relationships.quantification: 36% of Shark Bay seagrass damaged by 2010/2011 marine heatwave; 2-9 Tg CO2 released over 3 years
relationships.mechanism: Thermal stress causes seagrass dieback, exposing sediment carbon stocks to oxic conditions and remineralization
